text: 1. Mitosis of spermatogonia: forming spermatocytes — Spermatogenesis begins at puberty — Begins with spermatogonia « Stem cells that are in contact with epithelial basal lamina « Each mitotic division yields one type A daughter cell and one type B daughter cell — Type A cells maintain germ cell line at basal lamina — Type B cells move toward lumen and develop into primary spermatocytes
